intro: Cephaelis baillehachei, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
